question: Explain how a disorder can be caused by a combination of genetic and environmental factors.

sample_answer.full_answer: Some disorders are caused by a combination of genetic and environmental factors. This means that an individual may have a genetic predisposition to a disorder, but they will only develop the disorder if they are exposed to certain environmental triggers (2 marks). For example, an individual may have a genetic predisposition to lung cancer, but they will only develop the disease if they smoke cigarettes (2 marks).
